titleStmt.title: Cornucopiæ, or diuers secrets wherein is contained the rare secrets in man, beasts, foules, fishes, trees, plantes, stones and such like, most pleasant and profitable, and not before committed to bee printed in English. Newlie drawen out of diuers Latine authors into English by Thomas Iohnson.
titleStmt.author: Johnson, Thomas, d. 1644.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by J. Danter] for VVilliam Barley, and are to be sold at his shop at the vpper end of Gratious streete nere Leaden Hall,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop at the vpper end of Gratious streete nere Leaden Hall
